document.heading: Candy, Confectionery, Soft Drink, and Chewing Gum Sales Tax Amendment Act of 1981

history.narrative: Law 4-105, the “Candy, Confectionery, Soft Drink, and Chewing Gum Sales Tax Amendment Act of 1981,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 4-231, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on October 27, 1981 and February 23, 1982, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on March 10, 1982, it was assigned Act No. 4-166 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
